titles.title: Whate’er my God Ordains is Right

verse.name: v1
v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Whate’er my God ordains is right: He never will deceive me. He leads me by the proper path; I know He will not leave me. I take, content, what He hath sent. His hand can turn my griefs away, And patiently I wait His day, His hand can turn my griefs away.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Whate’er my God ordains is right, Though now this cup, in drinking, May bitter seem to my faint heart, I take it all, unshrinking. My God is true; each morn anew. Sweet comfort yet shall fill my heart, And pain and sorrow shall depart, Swee comfort and sorrow shall fill my heart.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Whate’er my God ordains is right. Here shall my stand be taken. Though sorrow, need, or death be mine, Yet am I not forsaken. My Father’s care is round me there. He holds me that I shall not fall, And so to Him I leave it all, He holds me that Ishall not fall.{/lang-eng}
